comments.body: So is the pattern to use the `[sig-xyzzy]` tag when the test is not in the _xyzzy/_ directory but tests the "xyzzy" feature?

Storage-only tests should be moved into the sig's directory.

Use SIGDescribe when in a sig's directory (storage/), which is preferred for simplified ownership/reviewing, otherwise manually add '[sig-storage]' to the appropriate tests.
There is a `SkipUnlessProviderIs(framework.ProvidersWithSSH...)` call in the test, so these providers are included: {"gce", "gke", "aws", "local"}. Does that include GCI?
gke will use GCI image. Is your test only starting NFS server? How about client?

@jingxu97 It starts the nfs-server pod and a client pod that will read/write to a nfs volume. Then the nfs-server is stopped and the client pod is deleted. Then the nfs-server is restarted. The test checks that the client pod's nfs mount has been deleted.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +151,155 @@func restartNfsServer(serverPod *v1.Pod) {

	const startcmd = "/usr/sbin/rpc.nfsd 1"
	ns := fmt.Sprintf("--namespace=%v", serverPod.Namespace)
	framework.RunKubectlOrDie("exec", ns, serverPod.Name, "--", "/bin/sh", "-c", startcmd)

comments.body: What do you think about making the image string a constant somewhere?  It is used throughout e2e tests.  How likely is it to change?
Agree. I think maybe a new PR should be created with the sole purpose of creating these constants for the nfs-server pod, busybox, and storage containers such as glusterfs and ceph.
Since this code specifically tests a particular volume plugin, how hard it is to move this into its own file? such `kubelet_nfs.go` or something?

@gnufied It may turn out to be a good idea to create new files for these tests; however, atm I am ok with keeping them in _kubelet.go_. Reasons: 1) using nfs is somewhat incidental since the main purpose of the test is to verify that the kubelet cleans up volume mounts and the pod's uid dir. I don't foresee needing this type of test for every in-tree storage plugin. 2) some of the existing tests in _kubelet.go_ are disruptive and so it seems that mine fits ok there, at least for now.
